intro: Chuquiraga fodinarum, commonly known as the Andean bur plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often surrounded by bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are typically hairy and alternate along the stems, and it thrives in high-altitude environments. Chuquiraga fodinarum is adapted to harsh, arid conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
